refnamediv.refpurpose: Collects a column value histogram for use in SQL optimization

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This function collects (or updates) values distribution data for a given column.
It splits the sorted column values in n_buckets intervals and collects the last value of each interval. The values are then inserted into the SYS_COL_HIST table.
If the table in question has not been analyzed, then it calls SYS_STAT_ANALYZE for the table.
The histograms are then used by the Optimized SQL compiler. All the cached compilations are discarded, because some of them may compile differently in the light of the new data.

refsect2.title: table_name
refsect2.para: The full name of the table exactly as in the KEY_TABLE column of SYS_KEYS.

refsect2.title: column_name
refsect2.para: The full name of the column exactly as in the COLUMN column in SYS_COLS.

refsect2.title: n_buckets
refsect2.para: How much intervals to form. If more intervals are available, the estimation of column predicates costs is more precise.

refsect2.title: prec
refsect2.para: The density of the rows examined. Defaults to 1 (all the rows)
